Variables

constexpr NullOptType NullOpt {int()}
 

Detailed Description

Automatically generated by Zserio C++ extension version 1.2.0.

The module provides help methods for manipulation with float numbers.

The following float formats defined by IEEE 754 standard are supported:

  • half precision float point format (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Half-precision_floating-point_format)
  • single precision float point format (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Single-precision_floating-point_format)
  • double precision float point format (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Double-precision_floating-point_format)

template<typename T >
using zserio::HeapOptionalHolder = typedef detail::optional_holder<T, detail::heap_storage<T> >

Optional holder which uses heap storage.

Optional holder which uses in place storage.

◆ OptionalHolder

template<typename T >
using zserio::OptionalHolder = typedef detail::optional_holder< T, typename detail::optimized_optional_storage<T, detail::is_optimized_in_place<T>::value>::type>

Optional holder which decides in compile time which storage is used - in place for small types and heap for bigger ones.

Definition at line 584 of file OptionalHolder.h.

Enumeration Type Documentation

◆ PreWriteAction

enum zserio::PreWriteAction

Enum defining bit-mask values pre-write action configuration.

Enumerator
NO_PRE_WRITE_ACTION 

Perfrom no pre-write action.

PRE_WRITE_INITIALIZE_CHILDREN 

Initialize children during the pre-write action.

PRE_WRITE_INITIALIZE_OFFSETS 

Initialize offsets during the pre-write action.

ALL_PRE_WRITE_ACTIONS 

Perform all pre-write actions.

Definition at line 8 of file PreWriteAction.h.

◆ bitSizeOf() [2/2]

template<typename T >
size_t zserio::bitSizeOf ( T  value)

Gets bit size of the given enum item.

Note that T can be varuint, so bitSizeOf cannot return constant value and depends on the concrete item.

Parameters
valueEnum item.
Returns
Bit size of the enum item.

◆ getNumBits()

uint8_t zserio::getNumBits ( uint64_t  numValues)

Gets the minimum number of bits required to encode numValues different values.

This method implements Zserio build-in operator numbits.

Note: Please note that this method returns 0 if numValues is zero.

Examples: numbits(0) = 0 numbits(1) = 1 numbits(2) = 1 numbits(3) = 2 numbits(4) = 2 numbits(8) = 3 numbits(16) = 4

Parameters
numValuesThe number of different values from which to calculate number of bits.
Returns
Number of bis required to encode numValues different values.

Definition at line 6 of file BuildInOperators.cpp.
